p: Freshly extracted and clean pomegranate seeds (PS) were blanched in a water bath (Scientific, South Africa) at 95 ± 2 °C for 3 min [ 9]. After blanching, samples were cooled promptly in an ice water bath, drained off, and then oven dried at 55 ± 2 °C to 10% ( w/w) moisture content. The thermogravimetric technique was applied to measure the moisture content using a moisture analyzer set at 100 °C (KERN, DBS60-3, Balingen, Germany).
